etymologies: mid 19th century. From nitro- + aniline, perhaps after German Nitranilin

definitions: Each of three isomeric yellow or orange crystalline compounds, C₆ H₄ (NO₂)(NH₂), which are derivatives of aniline having a nitro group attached to the carbon ring, and are used in the manufacture of dyes; nitrophenylamine.

notes.text: "N-nitroaniline" noun a pearly-white crystalline compound, NO₂NHC₆H₅, isomeric with nitroaniline, but with the nitro group attached to the amine group; phenylnitramine.
